NoteLiteral.En:
Application deadline: 31 March, 2025


Minimum 90 ECTS credits obtained in the business area.


Language proficiency level – B2 (CEFR)


Recruitment documents (in English only): CV, transcript of records and motivation letter containing

information about the student’s personal motivation to join the challenge, attitude towards

experimenting and trying out new educational models.


When admitted, you will be contacted by the host university regarding the next steps in the process.

Description.En:
In this learning opportunity, conducted by the Faculty of Organization and Management of Lodz University of Technology in collaboration with Kaunas University of Technology and Dublin City University, students have the opportunity to participate in remote classes, where they gain knowledge and skills in CBL and computer simulation methods, as well as a face-to-face week in Łódź, Poland. 

Upon completion of the program, students will receive a certificate of participation and a certification in computer simulation issued by the REVAS company. This challenge is targeted at students of business faculties and those interested in synchronous/asynchronous learning through computer simulations. You will be introduced to the CBL method, Miro, Wikamp Port (Lodz University of Technology learning management system LMS), and the specifics of computer simulations, and work collaboratively in project teams consisting of approximately 3 to 5 people. The challenge culminates in presentations of the outcomes achieved by each team during a face-to-face meeting in Łódź. Emphasis is placed on communication, feedback, peer learning, and self-development.

NoteLiteral.En: use collaborative tools in online workshops
design and present problem solutions adequate for CBL method
based on result analysis, make effective decisions in problem solving
collaborate in international groups in various teamwork modalities
critically analyze and engage with cultural issues, demonstrating the ability to apply inclusive practices in diverse settings by respecting, understanding, and addressing cultural differences.

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
The challenge will be run from May 6/ to June 27, 2025  

Online meetings will take place on Tuesdays from 16:00 to 20:00 CET on: May 6 (Introduction), May 13 (Engage stage); May 20, May 27, June 3 (Investigate stage); June 10 (Act stage) On-site, face-to-face meeting in Poland (Act stage) will take place from June 23 to June 27, 2025 (10:00-16:00 CET every day). All participants are invited to spend a week at Lodz University of Technology campus in Łódź where they will collaborate, integrate, and participate in cultural activities. This week is an integral part of the programme, and therefore is not optional.  

Please check with your ECIU mobility officer if you are eligible for an Erasmus+ grant (BIP) and apply for this ECIU Challenge. Successful candidates will receive full details of travel and accommodation suggestion options on being enrolled to the intensive programme

This challenge promotes international mobility and has the format of the Erasmus+ Blended Intensive Programme. The total workload is 50 hours, of which 30 are contact hours and 20 online hours (5 days online and 5 days face-to-face). [\*Embedded MM 5 online+6 on-site] 

The learning outcomes are assessed as follows:

LO 1: Revas certificate

LO 2: presentation (f2f meeting)

LO 3: reports

LO 4: peer-review, teacher observations, meeting minutes

LO 5: observations

Evaluation is based on the on-site final presentation (pitch) of a project resulting from the virtual component and the findings developed during the face-to-face meeting in the company in Łódź.  

The final mark is calculated as follows: on-line 50% + on-site 50% (60% positive evaluation is required to pass the course).
Practical Solutions for Managing Challenges in Industry through Simulations.

Are you ready to collaborate with a world-wide stakeholder and transform its managing industrial organization system? Through a real-world, challenge-based project, and working on-line and face-to-face in international teams, you will connect global and local issues and actions to design impactful solutions. Through business simulations, you will develop analytical, problem-framing, critical thinking, teamworking and leadership skills. During the face-to-face meeting, you will engage in workshops, experience a factory tour, listen to guest speakers and experts who will offer business insights.

Application deadline: 31 March, 2025

Minimum 90 ECTS credits obtained in the business area.

Language proficiency level – B2 (CEFR)

Recruitment documents (in English only): CV, transcript of records and motivation letter containing information about the student’s personal motivation to join the challenge, attitude towards experimenting and trying out new educational models. When admitted, you will be contacted by the host university regarding the next steps in the process. 

5 meetings are organized online; 1 weekly face-to-face meeting takes place in Łódź.

This challenge has an embedded micromodule on Challenge-based Learning through cases, conducted online and through MS Teams meetings.
